intro: Enckea amalago var. hirtella, commonly known as the hairy enckea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
